definition:
A sheaf of ${\mathcal{O}}_X$-modules ${\mathcal{F}}$ on a ringed space
$X$ is called [*locally free*]{} if for each point $p\in X$, there is an
open $U$ of $x$ such that ${\mathcal{F}}|_U$ is as an
${\mathcal{O}}_X|_U$-module, or equivalently, ${\mathcal{F}}_p$, the
stalk of ${\mathcal{F}}$ at $p$, is free as a
$({\mathcal{O}}_X)_p$-module. If ${\mathcal{F}}_p$ is of $n$, then
${\mathcal{F}}$ is said to be of rank $n$.
